alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 10:48AM EST until March 15 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Driftwood River near Edinburgh. East Fork White River from Columbus to Bedford. .Minor flooding will continue or develop along portions of the Driftwood, East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers for the next several days. Flooding is occurring due to significant rainfall which occurred last weekend. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. The high water situation is likely to begin to improve along northern reaches of the main stem rivers within the next few days, while flooding will last longer further south. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River near Rivervale. * WHEN...From late tonight to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, During the late March 2008 flood, the Bedford Times reported the following county roads still under water: River Road, Bartlettsville Road by the bridge and in the bottoms, Judah-Logan Road by the bridge, the gravel part of Logan Bottoms, Donica Church Road between Logan Bottoms and the hill, Peerless Road by Mica Metals, Little Salt Creek Run, Stumphole Bridge Road near SR 450, Huron-Williams Road, Lawrenceport Road, Rivervale Road and Earl Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 24.1 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1100 PM EST.
